titleStmt.title: Application to Sublease Date Crop
titleStmt.author: Maron, son of Melankomas, and Eukrates, son of Herakleides

revisionDesc.change: Pull translation out of APIS record.

div.ab: To Herakleides, son of Pnepheros, from Maron, son of Melankomas, and Eukrates, son of Herakleides. We wish to lease two-thirds of the date crop which arrived at maturity in the present third year of Gaius Caesar Augustus Germanicus and which you hold on lease. We promise to pay, for the whole, a rent of twenty-six drachmai of coined silver and . . . obols, and we will pay it in the month of Tybi of the same year, if it appears good to lease to us on the aforesaid terms.;Year 3 of Gaius Caesar Augustus, 29th of the month of Augustus.;Eukrates, son of Herakleides, 30 years old, with a scar on the lower part of the left cheek.;(2nd hand) I, Maron, son of Melankomas, have also submitted the aforesaid application. And we will pay one artaba of Syrian dates by the dromos-measure for dates.;Year 4 of Gaius Caesar Augustus, 29th of the month of Augustus.
